titles.title: A bill to prohibit the denial or abridgment of the right of former criminal offenders to vote in elections for Federal office.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 5/21/1987--Introduced. States that the right of a U.S. citizen to vote in a Federal election shall not be denied or abridged because he has committed a criminal offense (unless such citizen is imprisoned in a correctional institution at the time of such election). Provides criminal penalties for intentionally denying a person such right.
